deprecation_note: SUPERSEDED by corridor.lifecycle.state-machine.v2.json. This v1 definition uses incorrect state names (PROPOSED, OPERATIONAL) that diverge from the spec (DRAFT, PENDING, ACTIVE, HALTED, SUSPENDED, DEPRECATED). See audit finding 2.3 in docs/fortification/sez_stack_audit_v2.md. The Rust implementation (msez-state crate) uses the spec-correct typestate names. All new code MUST reference v2.

allowed_transitions.description: Corridor becomes operational after activation criteria are met (e.g., agreement VCs satisfied).
Emergency halt (e.g., detected fork / safety incident).
Resume operations after a fork is resolved and/or incident is mitigated.
Corridor deprecation / sunset; receipts should stop and migration should begin.
Deprecate a halted corridor after incident resolution / migration decision.
